name: nsrdude
text: Running a mile makes my voice all chunky, of course I dont nearly have diabetes, I am just lazy.

name: macdaddyw
text: I'm just fat. Everything about me is chunky...everything...

name: laserblade
text: Course I'm fat!  Being fat rocks!

name: macdaddyw
text: A comment left by macdaddyw was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Mangtastic, kenthegod, Ariamaki, NDCaesar, Pigs)

name: tekende
text: Do you see those four lames? Those might have been chubbies, macdaddyw. They might have been chubbies, if only you had spelled "clothes" correctly.

name: fineoakstructure
text: he was just saying you shoud by bigger pance.

name: lexsenthur
text: That was kinda a fo' paw on his part.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: course he got fo paws

name: psquid
text: Chubby for snatching victory from the jaws of defeat.

name: the_voice
text: laserblade totally doesn't care that he's fat! Rock on, 1aserblade!

name: the_voice
text: What? Why is that a "1"? Why did I fuck things up?

name: valrus
text:
Those keys are right next to each other.
Wait, no they're fucking not. They're on opposite sides of the keyboard. How did you do that?

name: spencersage
text: He has chunky fingers.

name: dipstikk
text:
Chubby for a witty observation that made me laugh.

It is true. We, the people of fat, oft have frequent encounters with the backspace key because of a condition known as "Sausagefingeritis."

name: i_love_kate
text:
I read this as "sausagefingertits".

Which I probably shouldn't go around saying in case I accidentally name the next Tom Waits album.

name: fathington
text: Better get himself a special typing wand.

name: saint
text: Chubbied for the excellent recovery, sir.

name: layzerblade
text: Since posting that, I lost 30 pounds. Which rocks in its own way.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Rock on, layzerblade.

name: charchar
text: Your chunkiness earns you a chubby.

name: lolsworth
text: I am depression-tubby.

name: muscles
text: A comment left by muscles was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, DeimosRising, rhymesforkids)

name: deimosrising
text: He expects Beef to signal that he has finished reading that side of the paper - he will then turn it over, to reveal the rest of the statement.

name: hyetal
text: That is exactly what makes this comic a gem.

name: mercuri0us
text: Cold 5 for the word (over) alone.

name: waitwhat
text: A comment left by waitwhat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, riotdejaneiro, StoatLad, Jesler729, tibcoolbreeze, instantkarma, equinn2006, greenkoolayd, rhymesforkids, NDCaesar, MortisInvictus, gethen, ConnorMc, logic, ravindra108, Setzkin, mugi, Zem, Boyd, smilebuddha, tovarich, echidnaboy, Aerys, Mastronaut)

name: saint
text: you deserve every lame you get.

name: tekende
text: There's nothing good about who you are or what you do.

name: echidnaboy
text: This comment [url=http://charleysmuckles.blogspot.com/2005/ 02/got-to-rethink-tha-jobb-prospektzz.html]cold eats a peter[/url].

name: echidnaboy
text: Ironically, so does this one.

name: sherwood
text: -scrit scrit scrit-

name: hellofyellin
text: Roast Beef is good at talking to people's parents.

name: spinynorman
text: If Molly's parents hadn't been dead for 400 years he could really shine for her.

name: agentstinky
text: OH HO it's one of those comments that seems odd in light of later continuity.

name: sredni
text: The real artwork here is Ray's eyebrows. They tell the story by themselves.

name: scion
text: They are truly expressive, yes, like...Patrick Stewart on Broadway. Like...your mother's silence.

name: nurdbot
text: Rays Mother can sense diabetes like Obi-Wan can sense planetcide in the force. She is that old fashioned. I am also curious what Rays message on the other side says.

name: plummet
text: Ray is showing hell of belly there

name: epicurus
text: Fuck I love this one. Hard to pick out anything specific  but I will mention that my mom is exactly like this and also I love how Ray bothered to write (over) at the end of his angry sentence.

name: 1000hz
text: Ray underlined "hell". Twice.

name: woof
text: alt text: It's true, though. Ray has never been mindful of good sense.

name: rotating-dog
text: Mention the RUN

name: liquidcruelty
text: The last panel of this is one of my favorites ever and also yes Roast Beef is the sort of dude that your mom is ok with you hanging around

name: paperboy_2000
text: Running a damn mile by itself doesn't do any good against diabetes. It's how many people know that you ran a damn mile. In fact, if ten people know you ran a mile that's pretty much the same thing as running ten miles as far as diabetes is concerned.

name: someone3
text: A comment left by someone3 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by asumoactingbig, Mastronaut, Darthemed)

name: connellingus
text: Ray looks like he could really use a four-sided sign right about now.

name: girdag
text: Possibly my favourite Achewood strip ever.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I love Beef's expression in panel 8. Great little touch of him reading the sign.

name: satellitetv
text: It cold sucks

name: dasilodavi
text: I think the rant should continue, having been written on Showbiz's patented 4-sided cardboard sign.

name: falseprophet
text: Ray's facial expression in the last panel makes this strip a five. He accents the text of his card by opening his mouth in a shouting pose like an avatar in a 16-bit role playing game when there is text on the screen.

name: pyro_ike
text: The last sign totally makes it, especially the underlining for emphasis.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Teodor: STOP WAKING ME UP
Onstad: I have a new bed.

name: stereo
text: I like how they have dachshunds, which the characters know about, but which have never appeared in cartoon form.

name: tekende
text: Well, Teodor, maybe you should go to bed earlier, HMM?

name: i_love_kate
text: I will genuinely never forgive you for saying this.

name: i_love_kate
text: I have had bad experiences with loud flatmates.

name: direhaggis
text: Roast Beef is stone cold reading a magazine such as all Wired or Reminisce, all non-plussed at Ray's run, all using double negatives eloquent like reassuring Ray's mother is a natural second nature.

name: andyboy
text: Furious scritting.

name: null
text: I bet after the (over) it just says something like, "like that?" which Ray could've easily fit on the front had be been more mindful of common sense.

name: lolsworth
text: Disturbing lack of chubbies for this

name: ndcaesar
text: The cat's fear of diabetes stems from his mother's anxieties.

name: dybrar
text: A mother just knows

name: tekende
text: So, who believes Ray? Who actually believes that he ran a mile?

name: thedice
text: Well, Ray does. That's all that matters.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Ray ran a mile like I run a mile: I run what feels like a mile to me, and then later, while looking at a map of the trail I was on, liberally estimate where I started running and where I stopped, so that it approximates a mile ("yeah, 3/5 of a mile on this map is basically a mile; the map doesn't include the hills")

It makes a guy feel pretty good.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Hey guys, I totally run more than a mile now, for real.

Thanks.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i hate running if im not preserving my own life, but i like to go bike riding.  what is with that?

name: treatyofparis
text: "(over)" is one of my favorite achewood punchlines.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Oh, fuck you.
